attributes.action: Draw a distinction between asylum seekers and legal immigrants!
attributes.additional_details: Politicians are doing what they believe the country wants, but this false identification is causing legal immigration to be more difficult simply because the average Brit doesn’t distinguish between the word immigrant and the word asylum seeker after years of false news representation. The governments test groups therefore are inaccurate and we risk allowing legislation to pass that doesn’t actually represent what the people of the UK really feel and want.
attributes.background: People use ‘Immigrant’ as a blanket term, referring to legal and non legal migrants, so when people speak out against immigration, meaning illegal, the government wrongly makes all immigration channels more difficult. We want parliament to publicly re clarify and make legal channels easier.

rejection.details: We are not entirely sure what you would like the UK Government or Parliament to do. You can start a new petition setting this out more clearly.
